botanical_details.potentially_harmful: All parts can cause stomach upset if eaten. Wear gloves and wash hands after handling
botanical_details.genus: Paeonia may be herbaceous perennials or deciduous sub-shrubs with large, divided leaves and showy large bowl-shaped flowers, usually in early summer

how_to_grow.cultivation: Best in a deep, fertile, humus-rich soil that is moist but well-drained in a sheltered position in full sun or partial shade. May need support (see staking perennials). Long-lived but resents disturbance. See herbaceous peony cultivation for further information.
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by division in autumn or early spring
how_to_grow.pruning: Remove dead flowers as they fade, then cut plant back as the foliage dies down in autumn
how_to_grow.pests: Can be affected by leaf and bud eelworm and soil-dwelling swift moth caterpillar
how_to_grow.diseases: May be subject to a virus, honey fungus and peony wilt
